newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkey banks' 1996 short fx positions at $2.5 bln.
newsitem.headline: Turkey banks' 1996 short fx positions at $2.5 bln.

text.p: Turkish banks' short foreign currency positions fell by 18.3 percent to $2.52 billion last year from $3.09 billion in 1995, a treasury report said.

It said state banks carried a long position of $168 million in 1996 after $356 million short in 1995, while private banks' short currency positions rose by 15 percent to $2.57 billion. Foreign banks' short positions fell to $137 million from $442 million same period.
Development and investment banks had $21 million of long currency positions in 1996, after $50 million short in 1995.
"The central bank's adequate foreign currency reserves and controlled foreign currency policies will keep the market far away from a crisis," the report said.
